title: Special Task Force to be housed in Colombo’s critical police stations
byline: Sri Lanka Police has taken a crucial decision to call in the services of its Special Task Force to back crime-fighting operations and house them at six critical police stations in Colombo, in a bid to counter the increasing wave of organised shootings, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: IMF agreement will be further reviewed soon to grant more concessions to people: Deputy Minister
byline: The government will review the IMF agreement to grant more concessions to the people, Deputy Minister of Fiance Harshana Sooriyaperuma told Parliament today.

title: Manusha arrives at CID
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago to provide a statement.

title: MP Archchuna involved in altercation with traffic police
byline: Jaffna District MP Archchuna Ramanathan was reportedly involved in an altercation with a group of police officers on traffic duty in the Rambewa area of Anuradhapura.

title: Cancer vaccine once sold at Rs. 76,000 reduced to Rs. 370
byline: In the wake of statements about a cancer vaccine that was once sold for Rs.76,000 now being reduced to Rs. 370, medical sources confirmed the authenticity of the story to the Daily Mirror.

title: Trump signs slew of executive actions after being sworn in
byline: President Trump on Monday signed a flurry of executive orders, memorandums and proclamations after his inauguration, reversing many of his predecessors’ policies and reinstating actions from his first term in office.

title: “It’s an act of revenge,” Namal says on AKD’s rent demand to MR
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is resorting to political revenge by suggesting that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa should pay the rent or leave his official residence in Wijerama Mawatha, MP Namal Rajapaksa said today.
